value.title: Elon Musk
value.excerpt: Elon Musk is the co-founder and CEO at Tesla, overseeing all product design, engineering and manufacturing of the company's electric vehicles, battery products, and Solar Roofs.
value.name: Elon Musk
value.bio: Elon Musk is the co-founder and CEO at Tesla, overseeing all product design, engineering and manufacturing of the company's electric vehicles, battery products, and Solar Roofs.

value.title: Lex Fridman
value.excerpt: Research in machine learning, autonomous vehicles and human-centered AI at MIT and beyond. Host of the Artificial Intelligence podcast.
value.name: Lex Fridman
value.bio: Research in machine learning, autonomous vehicles and human-centered AI at MIT and beyond. Host of the Artificial Intelligence podcast.

value.title: Andrej Karpathy
value.excerpt: Director of AI at Tesla. Previously a Research Scientist at OpenAI, and CS PhD student at Stanford. I like to train Deep Neural Nets on large datasets.
value.name: Andrej Karpathy
value.bio: Director of AI at Tesla. Previously a Research Scientist at OpenAI, and CS PhD student at Stanford. I like to train Deep Neural Nets on large datasets.

value.title: Yann LeCun
value.excerpt: Yann LeCun is a French-American computer scientist working primarily in the fields of machine learning, computer vision, mobile robotics, and computational neuroscience.
value.name: Yann LeCun
value.bio: Yann LeCun is a French-American computer scientist working primarily in the fields of machine learning, computer vision, mobile robotics, and computational neuroscience.

value.title: Animashree Anandkumar
value.excerpt: Animashree Anandkumar is the Bren Professor of Computing at California Institute of Technology. She is a director of Machine Learning research at NVIDIA. Her research considers tensor-algebraic methods, deep learning and non-convex problems.
value.name: Animashree Anandkumar
value.bio: Animashree Anandkumar is the Bren Professor of Computing at California Institute of Technology. She is a director of Machine Learning research at NVIDIA. Her research considers tensor-algebraic methods, deep learning and non-convex problems.

value.title: Ilya Sutskever
value.excerpt: Co-founder and Chief Scientist of OpenAI. I spent three wonderful years as a Research Scientist at the Google Brain Team. Before that, I was a co-founder of DNNresearch. And before that, I was a postdoc in Stanford with Andrew Ng's group. And in the beginning, I was a student in the Machine Learning group of Toronto, working with Geoffrey Hinton.
value.name: Ilya Sutskever
value.bio: Co-founder and Chief Scientist of OpenAI. I spent three wonderful years as a Research Scientist at the Google Brain Team. Before that, I was a co-founder of DNNresearch. And before that, I was a postdoc in Stanford with Andrew Ng's group. And in the beginning, I was a student in the Machine Learning group of Toronto, working with Geoffrey Hinton.

value.title: The Most Influential AI Researchers in 2020
value.excerpt: These are some of the most vocal and influential leaders working on artificial intelligence in 2020.
value.name: The Most Influential AI Researchers in 2020
value.bio: These are some of the most vocal and influential leaders working on artificial intelligence in 2020.

topItems.title: Andrew Ng
topItems.excerpt: Co-Founder of Coursera; Stanford CS adjunct faculty. Former head of Baidu AI Group/Google Brain. #ai #machinelearning, #deeplearning #MOOCs
topItems.name: Andrew Ng
topItems.bio: Co-Founder of Coursera; Stanford CS adjunct faculty. Former head of Baidu AI Group/Google Brain. #ai #machinelearning, #deeplearning #MOOCs

topItems.title: Yoshua Bengio
topItems.excerpt: Yoshua Bengio OC FRSC is a Canadian computer scientist, most noted for his work on artificial neural networks and deep learning. He was a co-recipient of the 2018 ACM A.M. Turing Award for his work in deep learning.
topItems.name: Yoshua Bengio
topItems.bio: Yoshua Bengio OC FRSC is a Canadian computer scientist, most noted for his work on artificial neural networks and deep learning. He was a co-recipient of the 2018 ACM A.M. Turing Award for his work in deep learning.

topItems.title: Geoffrey Hinton
topItems.excerpt: Geoffrey Everest Hinton CC FRS FRSC is an English Canadian cognitive psychologist and computer scientist, most noted for his work on artificial neural networks. Since 2013 he divides his time working for Google and the University of Toronto.
topItems.name: Geoffrey Hinton
topItems.bio: Geoffrey Everest Hinton CC FRS FRSC is an English Canadian cognitive psychologist and computer scientist, most noted for his work on artificial neural networks. Since 2013 he divides his time working for Google and the University of Toronto.

value.excerpt: Consulting CTO at Oculus VR. Working on artificial general intelligence (AGI) in Facebook

topItems.title: Daniela L. Rus
topItems.excerpt: Daniela L. Rus is a roboticist, the Director of the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, and Andrew and Erna Viterbi Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
topItems.name: Daniela L. Rus
topItems.bio: Daniela L. Rus is a roboticist, the Director of the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, and Andrew and Erna Viterbi Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

topItems.title: Joy Buolamwini
topItems.excerpt: Joy Adowaa Buolamwini is a Ghanaian-American computer scientist and digital activist based at the MIT Media Lab. She founded the Algorithmic Justice League, an organisation that looks to challenge bias in decision making software.

topItems.bio: Joy Adowaa Buolamwini is a Ghanaian-American computer scientist and digital activist based at the MIT Media Lab. She founded the Algorithmic Justice League, an organisation that looks to challenge bias in decision making software.

topItems.excerpt: Karl Iagnemma is an American writer and research scientist. He is also the CEO of self-driving technology company NuTonomy.

value.title: 'Godfathers of AI' won 2018 Turing Award
value.excerpt: The 2018 Turing Award, known as the “Nobel Prize of computing,” has been given to a trio of researchers who laid the foundations for the current boom in artificial intelligence.

value.title: Soumith Chintala
value.excerpt:
I ❤ research -- multi-modal world models, robots.
I think deeply about lowering the barrier to use A.I.
I co-created and lead PyTorch at Facebook A.I.

value.title: Rodney Brooks
value.excerpt: Rodney Brooks is the Panasonic Professor of Robotics (emeritus) at MIT. He is a robotics entrepreneur and most recently was Founder and CTO of Robust.ai

value.excerpt: Lead of AI Developer Relations at Google. Futurist, Optimist, Artist, Advocate and Author of SciFi, NonFic and more. Tries to be nice.

value.excerpt: Entrepreneur. Scientist. Co-founder and CEO @Affectiva. On a mission to humanize technology with #EmotionAI - YGL @WEF. #HumanFirst

value.title: Kai-Fu Lee
value.excerpt: Kai-Fu Lee is a Taiwanese-born American computer scientist, businessman, and writer. He is currently based in Beijing, China. Lee developed the world's first speaker-independent, continuous speech recognition system as his Ph.D. thesis at Carnegie Mellon.
value.name: Kai-Fu Lee
value.bio: Kai-Fu Lee is a Taiwanese-born American computer scientist, businessman, and writer. He is currently based in Beijing, China. Lee developed the world's first speaker-independent, continuous speech recognition system as his Ph.D. thesis at Carnegie Mellon.

value.excerpt: Particle physics, LHC, stats/ML/AI, collaborative & open science. Executive Director Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment at NYU.

value.bio: Particle physics, LHC, stats/ML/AI, collaborative & open science. Executive Director Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment at NYU.

value.title: Rosalind Picard
value.excerpt: Rosalind Wright Picard is an American scholar who is Professor of Media Arts and Sciences at MIT, founder and director of the Affective Computing Research Group at the MIT Media Lab, and co-founder of the startups Affectiva and Empatica.
value.name: Rosalind Picard
value.bio: Rosalind Wright Picard is an American scholar who is Professor of Media Arts and Sciences at MIT, founder and director of the Affective Computing Research Group at the MIT Media Lab, and co-founder of the startups Affectiva and Empatica.

value.title: Kate Crawford
value.excerpt: Co-founder @AINowInstitute, NYU | Principal Researcher MSR | Distinguished Research Professor NYU | Chair of AI and Justice, École Normale Supérieure

value.title: Nando de Freitas
value.excerpt: Nando de Freitas is a Professor of Computer Science at the University of Oxford. He is also a Fellow of Linacre College, Oxford. De Freitas is noted as an authority in the field of machine learning, and in particular in the subfields of neural networks, Bayesian inference and Bayesian optimization, and deep learning.
value.name: Nando de Freitas
value.bio: Nando de Freitas is a Professor of Computer Science at the University of Oxford. He is also a Fellow of Linacre College, Oxford. De Freitas is noted as an authority in the field of machine learning, and in particular in the subfields of neural networks, Bayesian inference and Bayesian optimization, and deep learning.
